meta.description:
UHF ground station
Kenwood TS-2000
Rotator G5500

(If Station is in Testing Mode it's being used for SSB Sat work or down for Maintenance) 
Pi 3 B+, RSP1A, Nooelec LNA, DIY Folded Dipole Driven 7el X-Pol Yagi on 10ft Boom.
https://www.arrl.org/shop/files/pdfs/Satellite%20project.pdf

Ground station project  specifically designed for communication with small satellites in Low Earth Orbit using VHF and UHF amateur radio frequencies and provide hands-on educational projects in the world
The ground station can autonomously track satellites by using these equipments :
 VHF / UHF amateur radio transceiver (Amateur bands 144-16 MHZ and 430-440 MHZ)
Rotator Controller
Azimuth and elevation rotators 
UHF and VHF Yagi antennas (Amateur bands 144-16 MHZ and 430-440 MHZ)
Modems...

I have released the station to an active status due to a few decoded signals from satellites such as LILACSAT. This is my version of the EggNogs Eggbeater antenna that is tuned for the VHF band @ ~40'. The station is a Raspberry Pi 5, RTLSDR V4, along with a Nooelec LaNA. Final configuration will depend on performance during its use and will be adjusted where warranted. Additionally, this station will be remotely mounted at the antenna like its UHF sister station.

Research in the field of Nano-Satellites!
The Space Company.
Research Engineer and SPoC at UNISEC INDIA.
I also have an Amateur Callsign, VU3HJT.
Also proud Partner of the INTERCONTINENTAL AEROSPACE COMMAND. (IACS) 
Committee of Space Development, Novi Sad, Serbia. (CSPD)
(INDO-SERBIA)

LimeSDR on Raspi 4 - Antenna: 5/8 vertical homemade - LNA1: SSB antenna preamp - LNA2: Hartwig ultra low noise amp + dual helical filter.
luister en kijken
Test-Groundstation Germany near Frankfurt (Oder)

This station is a solar-powered raspberry pi, with a V-Dipole antenna, which may be relocated, and provided with a 3G/LTE data connection, for an even lower noise floor.  This station is also not close to any major towns or cities, meaning low interference. Future upgrades include 

-Adding A LNA
-Adding an FM Bandpass filter (We have some nearby FM Stations that transmit at high power levels)
-And a better power system that runs on lithium batteries instead of lead acid
Mullingar, 10+10 X-pol LFA, LNA, rtl-sdr

Main objectives of site is to monitor NOAA and Meteor M2 weather transmissions.
First ground station from Foundation Spacio Australis located in Valdivia Chile Grid Locator FF30je operated by Nicolás Donoso CD3NDC.

Passes to the East of the QTH are not advised given the current antenna location. 
Future: repositioning is planned for June 2025

Single dipole over chicken wire ground screen on flat roof with SPF5189 LNA at the feed point of the antenna followed by a 160 MHz low pass filter. Satnogs with Meteor M2 and M2 2 LRPT decoder, see this thread for more info: https://community.libre.space/t/meteor-mn2-decoder-for-rpi-3b/2493

Scheduling Meteor M2 passes is welcomed!

University of Applied Sciences Wiener Neustadt //  Setup:
- RaspberryPi (SatNOGS Client, satnogs_gr-satellites, satnogs-auto-scheduler)
- Windows PC (PstRotator)
- ADALM-PLUTO SDR
- RX: UHF Cross-Yagi (70 cm) + VHF Cross-Yagi (2 m) + Diamond MX-72N Duplexer + Sattrack BIG-RAS Rotator (0.5° Resolution) + SPID MD-01 Controller + Mast Pre-Amplifier DBA-270
